sentences.english: a 12-inch ruler

sentences.english: a sharp pencil
a blue pencil
a pencil sketch

detailed_translations.english: an instrument that you use for writing or drawing, consisting of a wooden stick with a thin piece of a black or coloured substance in the middle
to write something or make a mark with a pencil

sentences.english: Yes, I have your eraser, too.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我还拿了你的橡皮。

I have an eraser.

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of rubber that you use to remove pencil or pen marks from paper

sentences.english: He coloured the picture with crayon.
They send letters — one time in crayon — detailing their rights and how I am violating some maritime treaty from the 1700s.
sentences.chinese: 他们寄信，有一次甚至是蜡笔写的，详细的描述了他们的权利和我如何违反了某些1700年代的海上条约。

detailed_translations.english: a stick of coloured  wax  or  chalk  that children use to draw pictures

detailed_translations.english: the amount that a bag will hold

sentences.english: a ballpoint pen
a felt-tip pen
a pen and ink drawing

detailed_translations.english: an instrument for writing or drawing with ink

sentences.english: Put the pen and pencil in the pencil box.
sentences.chinese: 把钢笔和铅笔放在文具盒里。

sentences.english: In 1900, a father gave a pencil box for Christmas, and the child was all smiles.
sentences.chinese: 1900年，父亲给孩子一个铅笔盒当做圣诞礼物，孩子们欢天喜地。

sentences.english: Look, there is a pencil box and a pile of notebooks. There are still many books in it, Chinese book, maths book and English book.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，里面有铅笔盒，笔记本，还有好多好多的书，语文、数学、英语。

sentences.english: I’ve just started reading a book by Graham Greene.
sentences.chinese: 我刚开始看格雷厄姆·格林写的一本书。

sentences.english: a cookery book
Have you booked a holiday this year?
sentences.chinese: 你今年有没有预订去度假？

detailed_translations.english: a set of printed pages that are held together in a cover so that you can read them
to make arrangements to stay in a place, eat in a restaurant, go to a theatre etc at a particular time in the future

sentences.english: ‘Are you Italian?’ ‘No, I’m Spanish.’
sentences.chinese: “你是意大利人吗？”“不，我是西班牙人。”

sentences.english: ‘Do you want any more?’ ‘No thanks.’
sentences.chinese: “你还要再来点吗？”“不要了，谢谢。”

sentences.english: ‘Could you help me write this?’ ‘No, sorry, I haven’t got time at the moment.’
sentences.chinese: “你能帮我写这个吗？”“抱歉，不行，我现在没时间。”

sentences.english: He wanted to take me to a disco but I said no.
sentences.chinese: 他想带我去迪斯科舞厅，但是我拒绝了。

sentences.english: Sixty percent of people voted no.
If you’re asking whether I feel the same way about her, the answer is no.
sentences.chinese: 如果你问的是我对她是否也有相同的感觉，答案是没有。

detailed_translations.english: used to give a negative reply to a question, offer, or request

sentences.english: You should keep in with your colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 你应当与你的同事友好相处。

sentences.english: You should not deprecate your own worth.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该贬低你自己的价值。

sentences.english: We painted the door bright red .
a red balloon
I like the way the artist uses red in this painting.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢画家在这幅作品中对红色的运用。

the colour of blood

Raw coffee beans are green in colour.
a room decorated in pale blues and greens

the colour of grass and leaves

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of butter or the middle part of an egg
the colour of butter or the middle part of an egg
to become yellow or make something become yellow

She nearly always dresses in blue.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎总是穿蓝色的衣服。

detailed_translations.english: having the colour of the sky or the sea on a fine day
the colour of the sky or the sea on a fine day

sentences.english: a black evening dress
It was still pitch black (= very dark ) out.

detailed_translations.english: having the darkest colour, like coal or night

sentences.english: This particular model is available in brown, white, or grey.
sentences.chinese: 这个型号的产品有棕色、白色和灰色的。

orange peel

sentences.english: orange groves (= where orange trees grow )

detailed_translations.english: a round fruit that has a thick orange skin and is divided into parts inside

sentences.english: ‘How was the film?’ ‘It was okay, but not brilliant.’
sentences.chinese: “电影怎么样？”“还算可以，但谈不上很好。”

sentences.english: I think I did okay in the exam.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得这次考试我考得还可以。

detailed_translations.english: satisfactory but not extremely good
used to show that you agree with something or give permission for someone to do something
used to show that you agree with something or give permission for someone to do something

sentences.english: I have understood my mum. She has done all the things for the sake of me.
sentences.chinese: 现在我对未来充满了信心，我理解了妈妈，她所做的一切都是为了我。

detailed_translations.english: mother

sentences.english: She had a beautiful face.
Her face was white with fear.
A big smile spread across his face.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸上绽开了灿烂笑容。

sentences.english: I felt like punching him in the face.
sentences.chinese: 我真想给他脸上来一拳。

sentences.english: The birds build their nests in the rock face.

detailed_translations.english: the front part of your head, where your eyes, nose, and mouth are

sentences.english: She tucked her hair behind her ears.
sentences.chinese: 她把头发拢到耳朵背后。

detailed_translations.english: one of the organs on either side of your head that you hear with

sentences.english: He’s got beautiful eyes.
There were tears in her eyes as she listened to the story.
sentences.chinese: 她听故事时眼里噙着泪水。

sentences.english: A surgeon needs a good eye and a steady hand.
sentences.chinese: 做外科医生眼要准，手要稳。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two parts of the body that you use to see with

sentences.english: Someone punched him on the nose.
sentences.chinese: 有人一拳打在他的鼻子上。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a person’s or animal’s face used for smelling or breathing

sentences.english: He lifted his glass to his mouth.
Liam was fast asleep with his mouth wide open.
sentences.chinese: 利亚姆大张着嘴，睡得很熟。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your face which you put food into, or which you use for speaking

sentences.english: Dave has a broken arm .
Tim’s mother put her arms around him.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆的母亲伸出双臂搂着他。

sentences.english: Pat was carrying a box under his arm .
sentences.chinese: 帕特腋下挟着一个盒子。

sentences.english: He had a pile of books in his arms .

sentences.chinese: 他们臂挽臂走在沙滩上。

sentences.english: The old lady rushed to greet him, arms outstretched .
sentences.chinese: 老太太张开双臂，快步上前迎接他。

detailed_translations.chinese: 手臂；武器；袖子；装备；部门

to provide weapons for yourself, an army, a country etc in order to prepare for a fight or a war

sentences.english: Steve gripped the steering wheel tightly with both hands.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫双手紧握方向盘。

sentences.english: In her hand was a tattered old photograph.
sentences.chinese: 她手中拿着的是一张破旧的老照片。

sentences.english: the hour hand

sentences.english: He kissed the top of her head.
Alan fell asleep as soon as he put his head on the pillow.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦头一挨枕头就睡着了。

sentences.english: They dived head first into the water.
She was dressed in black from head to foot (= over all her body ).
sentences.chinese: 她从头到脚穿了一身黑。

sentences.english: He still has a full head of hair (= has all his hair, even though he is getting rather old ).
Jenny marched proudly at the head of the procession.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮自豪地走在游行队伍的前列。

sentences.english: David was asked to head up the technical team.
sentences.chinese: 戴维被要求领导技术小组。

sentences.english: the human body
My fingers were numb and my whole body ached.
He needs to overcome a negative body image (=  what you think about your own body  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他需要克服对自己身体的负面印象。

sentences.english: A dog found the body of a girl in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 一条狗在树林里发现了一具女孩的尸体。

sentences.english: the main body of the text

detailed_translations.english: the physical structure of a person or animal

sentences.english: a young boy with skinny legs
She fell and broke her leg.

detailed_translations.english: one of the long parts of your body that your feet are joined to, or a similar part on an animal or insect

sentences.english: My foot hurts.
I had blisters on the soles of my feet .
I dropped a glass earlier, so don’t walk around in bare feet .

He walked to the foot of the stairs.
He’s six feet tall , with blonde hair.
sentences.chinese: 他身高六英尺，一头金发。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body that you stand on and walk on

sentences.english: His mother always used to pick him up from school.

sentences.chinese: 如果她没有弯腰躲闪的话，那个球就可能击中她了。

sentences.chinese: 蒂姆低下身在镜子前梳头发。

sentences.chinese: 她低下头更仔细地看碑文。

sentences.english: He kept pigs and poultry.

detailed_translations.english: a farm animal with short legs, a fat body and a curved tail. Pigs are kept for their meat, which includes  pork  ,  bacon  and  ham  .

sentences.english: The police played an elaborate game of cat and mouse to trap him.
sentences.chinese: 警方跟他玩了一场精心布局的猫捉老鼠游戏，诱他落网。

sentences.english: a mother bear and her cubs

detailed_translations.english: a large strong animal with thick fur, that eats flesh, fruit, and insects

sentences.english: I could hear a dog barking .
He’s taken the dog for a walk .
We used to have a dog when I was young.
the most popular breed of dog

detailed_translations.english: a common animal with four legs, fur, and a tail. Dogs are kept as pets or trained to guard places, find drugs etc.

sentences.english: A trunk distinguishes the elephant.
So the part of the elephant I experience applies what we know about people and how we apply that to UX design.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我体验的那部分的大象就是我们对人的了解和我们将我们的了解应用于用户体验设计。

sentences.english: Tom: No.Although 75% of its raw materials is elephant dung, it is light delicate fragrance instead of stink. This is due to its special fabrication technology.
sentences.chinese: 不，尽管这种纸里75％的原料都是大象的粪便，但它不但不臭，反而有一种淡淡的清香，这是源于它的特殊的制造工艺。

detailed_translations.english: a very large grey animal with four legs, two tusks(= long curved teeth ) and a trunk(= long nose ) that it can use to pick things up

sentences.english: The monkey is beating up and down.
The monkey engulfed the food whole.
sentences.chinese: 这只猴子囫囵吞下食物。

sentences.english: The monkey had deflowered an entire section of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 这只猴子把花园中一整块地方的花都糟蹋了。

sentences.chinese: 黎明时分，鸟鸣声不绝于耳。

detailed_translations.english: a creature with wings and feathers that can usually fly. Many birds sing and build nests, and female birds lay eggs

sentences.chinese: 他像老虎一般地向我冲过来。

sentences.english: Or tiger ?

sentences.english: No. If the panda  has not quit by morning .
sentences.chinese: 不，如果明天早上那熊猫还不走

sentences.english: The road to the zoo turns off here.
sentences.chinese: 通向动物园的路由这儿拐弯。

sentences.english: Lionesses bearing cubs in the zoo is nothing new now.
sentences.chinese: 狮子在动物园繁殖早已屡见不鲜了。

If this is your idea of a joke, I don’t find it at all funny .
sentences.chinese: 如果你觉得这是个玩笑，那我认为它一点也不好笑。

sentences.english: Luckily, when I explained the situation, he saw the funny side (= recognized that it was partly funny ) .
sentences.chinese: 好在我把情况解释了以后，他看到了好笑的一面。

sentences.english: His laughter stopped her mid-sentence. ‘ What’s so funny? ’ she demanded.
sentences.chinese: 他的笑声打断了她的话。“有什么好笑的？”她厉声问道。

sentences.english: What’s that funny smell?

a piece of bread and butter

sentences.chinese: 请来一杯可乐和一杯番茄汁。

an ostrich egg

Joe always has bacon and egg for breakfast.

a pint of semi-skimmed milk
I helped to milk the cows.

to take milk from a cow or goat

a glass of sparkling mineral water

sentences.chinese: 处理破裂水管时，一定要先把水关掉。

sentences.english: contamination of the local water supply

sentences.chinese: 我不在时你能给我家里的盆栽浇浇水吗？

detailed_translations.english: the clear liquid without colour, smell, or taste that falls as rain and that is used for drinking, washing etc
if you water plants or the ground they are growing in, you pour water on them

sentences.chinese: 我们吃了蛋糕和冰激凌。

sentences.english: Over 1,500 different species of fish inhabit the waters around the reef.
sentences.chinese: 那片礁石周围的水域生活着1,500多种不同的鱼类。

sentences.english: The stonefish is the most deadly of all fishes.
sentences.chinese: 石鱼是所有鱼类中毒性最强的。

sentences.english: You usually drinks white wine with fish.
Dad really loves to fish.

detailed_translations.english: an animal that lives in water, and uses its fins and tail to swim
to try to catch fish

a few grains of rice

detailed_translations.english: a food that consists of small white or brown grains that you boil in water until they become soft enough to eat

sentences.english: They had one daughter.
one hundred and twenty-one pounds
Come back at one (= one o’clock ).
Katie’s almost one (= one year old ).
The children seemed upset. One was crying.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子好像不开心，有一个在哭。

detailed_translations.english: the number 1
used to refer to a member of a group or pair of people or things

sentences.english: I’d like you to line up in twos, please.
sentences.chinese: 请你们两个一组排好队。

detailed_translations.english: in groups of two people or things

sentences.chinese: 他们赢了最近三场比赛。

sentences.english: We’d better go. It’s almost three (= three o’clock ) .
My little sister’s only three (= three years old ) .

detailed_translations.english: the number 3
the number 3

They arrived just after four (= four o’clock ) .
sentences.chinese: 刚过四点钟，他们就到了。

sentences.english: Luke will soon be four (= four years old ) .

detailed_translations.english: the number 4

sentences.english: There is also a golf course five miles away.
sentences.chinese: 五英里外还有个高尔夫球场。

sentences.english: I’ll be back by five (= five o’clock ) .

sentences.chinese: 他五岁时全家移居加拿大。

detailed_translations.english: the number 5

She arrived just after six (= six o’clock ) .
He learnt to play the violin when he was six (= six years old ) .

the number 6

sentences.chinese: 这些女性访问了七个州的城市。

sentences.english: We close the store at seven (= seven o’clock ) .
‘How old’s Sam?’ ‘He’s seven (= seven years old ) .’

detailed_translations.english: the number 7
the number 7

sentences.english: It’s only eight days till Christmas.
They woke at eight (= eight o’clock ).
My parents died when I was eight (= eight years old ).

detailed_translations.english: the number 8

sentences.english: He’s only been in this job for nine months.
sentences.chinese: 他干这份工作才九个月。

sentences.english: We open at nine (= nine o’clock ).
Kay was taught by her mother till she was nine (= nine years old ).
sentences.chinese: 凯一直由她妈妈教到九岁。

detailed_translations.english: the number 9

sentences.english: Snow had been falling steadily for ten days.
I need to be home by ten (= ten o’clock ) .
At the time, she was about ten (= ten years old ) .

sentences.english: I have two brothers, William and Mark.
sentences.chinese: 我有两个兄弟，威廉和马克。

my twin brother
We must work together, brothers!
sentences.chinese: 我们必须携手工作，伙计们！

detailed_translations.english: a male who has the same parents as you

sentences.english: The plates were piled high with rice.

sentences.chinese: 一条漂亮的22开镀金项链
